Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create(user: User, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶

The create function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(user: User, contact_id: int, db: Session)¶
The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact object from the database based on the user_id and contact_id.
Args:

user (User): The User object that is requesting to get a Contact by id. contact_id (int): The id of the Contact being requested. db (Session): A Session instance for interacting with our database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact that we want to get

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(user: User, limit: int, offset: int, db: Session)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the contacts of a specific user

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Skip the first n contacts

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove(user: User, contact_id: int, db: Session)¶

The remove function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user who is making the request

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.set_favorite(user: User, contact_id: int, body: ContactFavoriteModel, db: Session)¶
The set_favorite function sets the favorite status of a contact.
Args:

user (User): The user who is making the request. contact_id (int): The ID of the contact to set as a favorite or not. body (ContactFavoriteModel): A model containing whether or not to set this as a favorite, and if so, what type of favoriting it should be.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact from the database

  • body – ContactFavoriteModel: Pass the is_favorite value to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update(user: User, contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶

The update function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the user object

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be updated

  • body – ContactModel: Pass in the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Search¶

async src.repository.search.get_birthday_list(user: User, shift: int, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The get_birthday_list function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user id from the user object

  • shift – int: Set the range of days in which we want to get birthdays

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of contacts that have a birthday in the next shift days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.search.get_contact_by_email(user: User, email: str, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The get_contact_by_email function returns a list of contacts that match the email provided.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user’s id from the database

  • email – str: Search for a contact by email

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.search.get_contact_by_firstname(user: User, firstname: str, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶
The get_contact_by_firstname function returns a list of contacts that match the firstname parameter.

The user_id is used to ensure that only contacts belonging to the current user are returned.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that is making the request

  • firstname – str: Search for contacts by firstname

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.search.get_contact_by_lastname(user: User, lastname: str, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The get_contact_by_lastname function returns a list of contacts that match the lastname parameter.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the user object

  • lastname – str: Filter the contacts by lastname

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.search.get_contact_by_phone(user: User, phone: str, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶
The get_contact_by_phone function returns a list of contacts that match the phone number provided.
Args:

user (User): The user who is making the request. phone (str): The phone number to search for in the database. db (Session): A connection to our database session, used for querying and updating data in our tables.

Returns:

List[Contact]: A list of contacts matching the given criteria.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user’s id from the database

  • phone – str: Filter the contacts by phone number

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.search.get_users_by_partial_info(user: User, partial_info: str, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The get_users_by_partial_info function takes in a user, partial_info, and db. It then searches for contacts by firstname, lastname, email or phone number that match the partial_info string. If any of these are found it appends them to a list called contacts and returns this list.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user_id of the user

  • partial_info – str: Search by firstname, lastname, email and phone number

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function sets the confirmed field of a user to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None, but the type hint says it returns none

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session)¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input and returns the newly created user.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Pass in the user object that is created by the usermodel class

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

A user object, which is then passed to the create_user_response function

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function returns a user object from the database if it exists, otherwise None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the type of data that is expected to be passed into the function

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A user object if the user exists, or none if it doesn’t

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Args:

email (str): The email address of the user to update. url (str): The URL for the new avatar image. db (Session, optional): A database session object to use instead of creating one locally. Defaults to None. # noQA: E501 line too long, but this is an example! # noQA: E501 line too long, but this is an example! # noQA: E501 line too long, but this is an example! # noQ

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is passed into the function

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_password(user: User, new_password: str, db: Session) → None¶
The update_password function updates the password of a user in the database.
Args:

user (User): The User object to update. new_password (str): The new password for this User object. db (Session): A Session instance that is used to commit changes to the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

  • new_password – str: Pass in the new password that will be set for the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_reset_token(user: User, reset_token, db: Session) → None¶
The update_reset_token function updates the password reset token for a user.
Args:

user (User): The User object to update. reset_token (str): The new password reset token to set for the user. db (Session): A database session instance, used to commit changes made by this function.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that is requesting a password reset

  • reset_token – Update the password_reset_token column in the users table

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, refresh_token, db: Session)¶
The update_token function updates the user’s refresh token in the database.
Args:

user (User): The User object to update. refresh_token (str): The new refresh token for this user. db (Session): A database session to use for updating the User object.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass in the user object that is currently logged in

  • refresh_token – Update the user’s refresh_token in the database

  • db – Session: Update the database with the new refresh token

Returns:

Nothing

Doc-author:

Trelent
